casebody.data:
PHG ASHEVILLE, LLC
v.
CITY OF ASHEVILLE 434PA18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. July 11, 2019 Catherine A. Hofmann, Assistant City Attorney, for City Of Asheville. Thomas E. Terrell, Jr., Attorney at Law, Greensboro, for PHG Asheville, LLC. Kip David Nelson, Attorney at Law, Greensboro, for PHG Asheville, LLC. Robin Tatum Currin, City Attorney, for City Of Asheville. Andrew H. Erteschik, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for City Of Asheville. Chad W. Essick, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for City Of Asheville. Colin R. McGrath, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for City Of Asheville. N. Cosmo Zinkow, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for City Of Asheville.

The following order has been entered on the Motion for Extension of Time to File Brief filed on the 11th of July 2019 by Petitioner:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 11th of July 2019."

Petitioner shall have up to and including the 21st day of August 2019 to file and serve his/her brief with this Court.
